duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the delivery of patient care and customer service, ensuring the timely resolution of concerns.
Supervise all technical ophthalmic imaging functions to include patient imaging and image quality management.
Ensure regulatory measures are followed to ensure a safe environment for patients and staff.
Monitor equipment performance and promptly report any equipment failures or needed repairs.
Jointly forecast staffing, capital, and budgetary needs.
Analyze and determine appropriate staffing to support clinical services while ensuring efficiency and maximizing resources.
Oversee human resource activities such as interviewing and hiring, training, verifying payroll, and managing employee performance.
Provide direct patient care in accordance with the incumbent's education and/or licensure.

education_certification.credential: Three (3) years of technical experience, or the equivalency.
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field, or equivalency.
Certification in at least six clinical study imaging protocols.
Current RQI Healthcare Provider eCredential through the University of Utah Health RQI system. The eCredential is to be obtained within 30 days of hire.
Additional license requirements as determined by the hiring department.
